original_title: World Bank to support Sri Lanka with another US $5.5 million
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The World Bank is set to provide financial assitance of US $5.5 million to streamline primary health services in Sri Lanka.
The Central Bank of Sri Lanka is set to receive the financial assiance in the next three to four days, Project Director at the Ministry of Health Dr. Jayasundara Bandara said.
The funding was released following a report provided to the World Bank on the operations of primary health services in Sri Lanka.
He also expressed hope of receiving another US $3.75 million in the next two months.
